Body:
Description: Hi,

This is regarding previous ticket 00423244. Apologies for the delayed response, but the customer has been indecisive about this matter. I recently had a meeting with them, and they are considering opting for a brand-new server as they feel their current one might be bloated. They have asked about the hardware requirements for a server running vSphere BUILD 7.0.3.0.1900 to support 500 clients with DC, DLP, DISCOVERY, and ENCRYPTION enabled. They plan to store data for one year. While they are not using shadow copy, file tracing is active on 60% of their machines, and the remaining machines have most ports blocked.

Additionally, they have a few questions regarding the process:

•Would they be able to transfer their existing license to the new machine?
•How would the new server communicate with the existing clients?
•What are the necessary steps to set this up in the safest and most efficient way?
•Would you provide a virtual device for them to download and configure? Their current version is 5.9.0.0.
•Could you please outline the steps in detail for them?

Best regards,

Damir

Next Steps Updated: As the customer is still in the process of preparing the new environment, we may close this ticket and when the customer is ready they can either create a new ticket or reply directly on this thread and this case will be reopened.
For now I will close the ticket and we will be ready to help customer when the time comes.

What We've Learned Updated: Customer wants to migrate from old Ubuntu EPP On-prem Server appliance to new EPP Server Appliance running on Ubuntu 22.04 on vSphere BUILD 7.0.3.0.1900 to support 500 clients with DC, DLP, DISCOVERY, and ENCRYPTION enabled.
